SEARCH
Package com.game.Tile

Class TileManager

java.lang.Object
com.game.Tile.TileManager
public class TileManager extends Object
Manages and renders tiles for the game environment based on map configurations.

This class is responsible for loading tile images, setting up the game map based on predefined configurations, and dynamically adjusting map elements such as introducing mysterious smoke tiles. It supports rendering the entire tile set to the game panel and changing tile sprites dynamically to reflect different game states or effects.

  • Constructor Details

    • TileManager

      public TileManager(MainGamePanel gp, String diff)
      Constructs a TileManager with specified game panel and difficulty setting.

      Initializes tile images and loads the map configuration based on the specified difficulty.

      Parameters:
      gp - The game panel to which the tiles will be rendered.
      diff - The difficulty setting of the game, affecting map layout and tile types.

  • Method Details

    • getTileImage

      public void getTileImage()
      Loads and assigns images to the tile types used in the game.

      Initializes the tile array with different types of tiles, setting their images, steppability, and special properties like ending a level or activating effects like mysterious smoke.

    • setSpriteChange

      public void setSpriteChange(int tileType, String filename)
      Dynamically changes the sprite of a specified tile type.

      Allows for dynamic visual changes in the game environment, such as activating effects or altering the appearance of tiles based on game events.

      Parameters:
      tileType - The index of the tile type to change.
      filename - The new image file to set as the sprite for the tile type.

    • loadMap

      public void loadMap()
      Loads the map configuration from a file based on the current difficulty setting.

      Reads a map layout file, assigning tile numbers to the map matrix to configure the game environment. It also introduces dynamic elements like mysterious smoke tiles based on random or predetermined conditions.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Renders the tiles to the game panel.

      Draws the tile set to the screen based on the current map configuration, handling the positioning and rendering of each tile according to its location in the map matrix.

      Parameters:
      g2 - The Graphics2D object used for drawing.

    • getMapDifficulty

      public String getMapDifficulty()

    • getMapTileNum

      public int[][] getMapTileNum()

    • getTile

      public Tile[] getTile()
